internal.content: --- title: "LogAnomaly Training" date: 2022-11-03T10:57:46+01:00 weight: 61 --- ## üöÄ TASK: Define and run LogAnomaly Training üåè Documentation for the Task: Setting up training for log anomaly detection - natural language In this section you will set up and run training for this AI algorithm to `detect unusual patterns in your logs` and notify you by generating an alert when they occur. Set up and run training for Logs ingested `from March 3rd 2022 to March 4th 2022` ## Define Log Anomalies Training 1. In the `CP4WAIOPS` "Hamburger" Menu select `Operate`/`AI Model Management` 1. Under `Log anomaly detection - natural language`, click on `Set up training` 1. Click `Next` 1. Under `Select data` check `Custom` 1. Select `Start date` as `March, 3rd 2022` 1. Select `End date` as `March, 4rd 2022` ![image](./../images/43_training.png) 1. Click `Next` 1. Click `Next` 1. Click `Next` 1. Under `Deployment type` check `On completion` 1. Click `Done` ## Run Log Anomalies Training 1. Click on the `Log anomaly detection - natural language` card 1. Click on `Train Models` 1. Status should say `In progress` 1. And eventually say `Deployed` ## Disable Log anomaly detection - statistical baseline 1. On the `Log anomaly detection - statistical baseline` card click on the slider to disable this algorithm (in this Lab we will focus on the natural language algorithm)

On the `Log anomaly detection - statistical baseline` card click on the slider to disable this algorithm (in this Lab we will focus on the natural language algorithm)
